['Vigilant', 'Watchful', 'Alertness heightened', 'Keen awaren Written by: John Doe', 'However, as these technologies continue to permeate every aspect of our lives, concerns about their potential dangers have also emerged', 'Experts assert that many fearful predictions have not materialized and are often driven by science fiction rather than scientific evidence.', 'They may not always make the best choices or take into account contextual factors that humans would consider.', 'Instead, technology tends to reshape the nature of work by allowing people to focus on more complex and creative endeavors that machines are incapable of performing', 'Many companies incorporate rigorous quality assurance procedures and monitoring measures in place for AI-driven technologies', 'Developers typically address potential weaknesses in their systems through continual updates and patching techniques, making breaches more difficult for hackers to accomplish.', 'By understanding the realities behind these misconceived notions, individuals can better prepare themselves for a future where AI plays an integral role in society while also ensuring that proper safeguards are implemented to address potential concerns.']

['رطب (Rathab) - Thirsty in Arabic, which can imply a metapmuniment for being left hungry when used in context.', "جنوسية الغذاء (Janwu'iah al-ghada') - Hunger (food) related personality in Persian.", '寻食者 (Xún shí zhě) - Seeking food eater in Chinese, which can be used when someone is left hungry and looking for sustenance.', "الشعراء النسيان (Al-sha'ara' al-nasiyan) - The ignorant poets in Arabic, sometimes humorously referring to those who forget or ignore the needs of others including hunger.", "حول طعم (Hawl ta'am) - Food around in Hebrew, indicating a gathering where food is expected but not present for some.", 'حلقة غزالة (Halqat ghazala) - Gazelle hunt feast in Arabic, used metaphorically when someone has been left hungry after an opportunity or event passed.', '밥이 없다 (Bap-i eopda) - There is no food in Korean, directly stating hunger.', "الشيء الغير مفصل (Al-shay' al-gheyr mafsaal) - The indivisible thing in Arabic, which can imply the universal need for food that cannot be ignored when used metaphorically.", '饿 (È) - Hungry in Chinese Mandarin.', "충고가없는 (Chung-go gae-eobsneun) - Lacking consideration or thoughtfulness in Korean, which can be used humorously to describe someone who hasn't provided food for others.", 'العطية الغذائية (Al-atiya al-ghadawiyah) - The dietary gift in Arabic, referring to the act of providing food as a favor or obligation.', 'भोजन की दर्द (Bhojan ki dard) - Food pain in Hindi, used when someone is suffering from hunger.', '饿死了 (È sǐ le) - Starve to death in Chinese Mandarin.', "سوء التزام (Saw'at altazam) - Breach of duty in Arabic, which can refer to the responsibility of providing food when someone is left hungry.", 'กินไหม (Kin mai) - Do you eat? in Thai, a question that implies hunger if no one responds affirmatively.', '친죽이다 (Chinjuk-ida) - To be hungry like an animal in Korean.', "جائعة (Jaa'aah) - Feast or something to eat in Arabic, which can imply the lack of such when used ironically for someone who has been left hungry.", '勤劳不足 (Qíng lóu bù zú) - Insufficient diligence or labor in Chinese Mandarin, metaphorically referring to not providing food due to lack of effort.', '無顧量 (Wú gùliáo) - Neglecting considerations in Chinese Mandarin, which can include the neglect to provide food for those who are hungry.', 'في الظل (Fay az-zul) - In shadows in Arabic, metaphorically referring to being ignored or overlooked when someone is left hungry without assistance.']
